intro: Gastrolobium rhombifolium, commonly known as the diamond-leaved wattle, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Fabaceae and is characterized by its distinctive diamond-shaped leaves. The plant produces yellow flowers that are clustered in spherical heads, typical of many wattles. It is often found in rocky or sandy soils in arid and semi-arid regions. Gastrolobium rhombifolium is a hardy, drought-tolerant species that thrives in well-drained environments.
